context: Utility company evaluating $120M investment in microgrid development for critical infrastructure resilience and renewable integration

request.purpose: Microgrid infrastructure for hospitals, data centers, and critical facilities with battery storage and solar integration
request.justification: Climate resilience and regulatory compliance for critical infrastructure protection

decision_process.outcome: Identified 25 high-priority sites with combined load of 500MW
Secured agreements with 20 facilities and regulatory approval framework
Projected 15% IRR with 8-year payback and substantial resilience benefits

business_impact.expected_outcome: 85% reduction in outage duration for critical facilities, 40% increase in renewable energy utilization
business_impact.projected_value: $200,000,000 in avoided economic losses over 15 years

lessons_learned: Early engagement with facility owners crucial for project success, comprehensive regulatory strategy prevented delays, modular design allowed for phased implementation reducing financial risk
